name: places/ChIJ7_Ho0-H1wokRWGUeZbr4Xr0

displayName.text: New York City Food Stamp Office

adrFormatAddress: 2322 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10035-1304, USA

originalText.text: I literally watched and saw videos poor work place ethic but this is the worst place for ppl to come too that needs help with anything. I video two workers laughing and talking for about 20 minutes while people were sitting and waiting for the numbers to be called, once they conversation, finish, one got up, put her jacket on and left and the other one left from out of the office and was walking around buying sodas for the security guards. While ppl waited for 2 to 3 hrs to be called. Their job requires them assist people in need not feel it's okay have them sitting for hours for no reason. Mind you These 2 ladies only prints lost cards or stolen cards. So how and long a person to supposed to wait just for a printed card. The sad part about it is because they know people in need and need help. This is how NYC alllow their city workers to treat ppl and not feel they have to do their jobs. A investigation need to done in this place so the government will see why ppl be so hostile in these types of environment or feel that can't the help that's needed so they would rather stay on the street and  commit crimes or resist help because of some city workers are lazy no good bums

originalText.text: Security is awesome but the man that approves child care is terrible. Yells at me in public and I believe it’s associated to my skin color. Will never come back. I feel for everyone that has to go through this long terrible process.

text.text: Security is awesome but the man that approves child care is terrible. Yells at me in public and I believe it’s associated to my skin color. Will never come back. I feel for everyone that has to go through this long terrible process.

originalText.text:
If I could give less than a star I would. Ms Roman (who doesn’t deserve to be called “Ms”) is a horrible supervisor and needs to be fired. Her attitude is horrible and she does very little to actually help people.

It’s crazy that people who are already going through a hard time have to be treated like less than by people who barely make enough to not qualify for SNAP. Maybe that’s why they have horrible attitudes.

When you call in they even know the Harlem center is trash. They sympathize with you for not being able to go to Brooklyn. This office is far behind in their case work and no one is working. Unsure why these reviews haven’t been addressed but they need fix the problem.

originalText.text: I tried calling this place and they don't pick up the phone. Instead they let it go to voicemail but the voicemail box is full. I don't think they call people back.

text.text: I tried calling this place and they don't pick up the phone. Instead they let it go to voicemail but the voicemail box is full. I don't think they call people back.

originalText.text: The online service does not care to help you the right way . I've waited for 2hours on many lines just to ask a question . I asked them to close my old application and they closed my current one and I've now bee waiting 4 mo ths to get services back on and can't reach a person.  The building doesn't answer the telephone and tells you leave a message for a call back & themalbox is full ..... so obviously they haven't returned calls . In person is no different only your physically there for hours on hours full of people and in a hot room with terrible service.
